title: How to Sew a Hand Stitched Buttonhole

steps.headline: Decide upon your buttonhole placement.
steps.description: Mark your fabric with a common pin.

steps.headline: Measure the size of your button.
steps.description: Using a ruler, measure the widest diameter of your button.

steps.headline: Cut a tiny slit in your fabric.
steps.description: For a snug fit, the slit should be slightly smaller than the diameter of your button. Stitching will slightly increase the size of the buttonhole.

steps.headline: Stitch around the opening of the buttonhole.
steps.description: Using double thread, stitch a tight blanket stitch. Place one stitch next to another. Place a second row of blanket stitch over the first row of stitching, if needed.
